com.thinkaurelius.titan.core

Interface TitanLabel

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Comparable<TitanElement>, com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Element, com.thinkaurelius.titan.util.datastructures.Removable, TitanElement, TitanType, TitanVertex, com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Vertex

    public interface TitanLabel
extends TitanType
    TitanLabel is an extension of TitanType for edges.

    In addition to TitanType, TitanLabel defines the directionality of edges:

    • Directed: An edge is directed if the order or position of its vertices matters. For directed edges, the outgoing vertex is considered the start and the incoming vertex the end. By default, labels and therefore edges are directed. Father is an example of a directed label.
    • Unidirected: An edge is unidirected if it is directed but only pointing in one direction. This means, the edge can only be traversed in the outgoing direction. As an example, a hyperlink is a unidirected edge. Unidirected edges can be stored more efficiently.
    Author:
    Matthias Bröcheler (me@matthiasb.com)
    See Also:
    TitanType

    • Method Detail

      • isDirected

        boolean isDirected()
        Checks whether this labels is defined as directed.
        Returns:
        true, if this label is directed, else false.

      • isUnidirected

        boolean isUnidirected()
        Checks whether this labels is defined as unidirected.
        Returns:
        true, if this label is unidirected, else false.
